value.title: Machine learning, harnessed to extreme computing, aids fusion energy development
value.excerpt: MIT research scientists Pablo Rodriguez-Fernandez and Nathan Howard have just completed one of the most demanding calculations in fusion science—predicting the temperature and density profiles of a magnetically confined plasma via first-principles simulation of plasma turbulence.

value.title: HPE releases ML development system to help companies deploy AI at scale
value.excerpt: HPE today released a new Machine Learning Development System. The ready-to-use system allows users to immediately build and train AI models at scale and realize faster value.

value.title: New HPE offerings aim to turbocharge machine-learning implementation
value.excerpt: Machine Learning Development System and Swarm Learning address implementation pain points for enterprise users.

value.title: Lighting up artificial neural networks with optomemristors
value.excerpt: A team of international scientists have performed difficult machine learning computations using a nano-scale device, named an "optomemristor."

value.title: HPE uses blockchain for distributed machine learning models
value.excerpt: HPE has lifted the lid on two new AI products, one aimed at enterprises wanting to build and train machine learning (ML) models at scale, and a second that introduces a decentralized ML system to enable distributed or edge deployments to share updates to their models.

value.title: Career roadmap: Machine learning scientist
value.excerpt: Data scientists and machine learning scientists have similar roles, but a machine learning scientist specializes in researching and implementing complex algorithms.

value.title: Eden AI unifies ML APIs from several cloud vendors
value.excerpt: French startup Eden AI has raised a $1.6 million pre-seed round (€1.5 million) to build a programming interface that lets you access AI engines from multiple vendors. The company unifies those APIs and offers a simple way to try them out,

value.title: Build and deploy a scalable machine learning system on Kubernetes with Kubeflow on AWS
value.excerpt: In this post, we demonstrate Kubeflow on AWS (an AWS-specific distribution of Kubeflow) and the value it adds over open-source Kubeflow through the integration of highly optimized, cloud-native, enterprise-ready AWS services. value.title: Pentagon Taps Lyft’s Machine-Learning Chief
value.excerpt: Craig Martell was named as the Defense Department’s first chief digital and artificial intelligence officer.

value.title: New DeepMind Framework Provides Fine-Grained Analysis of Distribution Shifts for ML Model Deployment
value.excerpt: When researchers create a new machine learning (ML) model, they seek to avoid the overfitting problem, where the model only performs well on data distributions similar to those in its training set. Instead,

value.title: Baseten nabs $20M to make it easier to build machine learning-based applications
value.excerpt: As the tech world inches a closer to the idea of artificial general intelligence, we’re seeing another interesting theme emerging in the ongoing democratization of AI: a wave of startups building tech to make AI technologies more accessible overall by a wider range of users and organizations.

value.title: Machine learning model can steer traumatic brain injury patients to life-saving care
value.excerpt: A prognostic model developed by University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine data scientists and UPMC neurotrauma surgeons is the first to use automated brain scans and machine learning to inform outcomes in patients with severe traumatic brain injuries (TBI).

value.title: Part 3: How NatWest Group built auditable, reproducible, and explainable ML models with Amazon SageMaker
value.excerpt: This is the third post of a four-part series detailing how NatWest Group, a major financial services institution, partnered with AWS Professional Services to build a new machine learning operations (MLOps) platform. value.title: How To Improve Demand Forecasting With Machine Learning And Real-Time Data

value.title: What happens when AI and ML turn rogue? Data poisoning
value.excerpt: Data poisoning is an attack method where hackers launch the attack through AI and ML. The rise of AI and ML is leading directly to the increasing threat

value.title: GIST researchers teach robots to identify partially hidden objects
value.excerpt: Typically, when AI is presented with a scene of cluttered objects, the system will try to identify each item based only on its visible parts.

value.title: Centers across the world improve the accuracy, ease of myocardial perfusion imaging with digital SPECT and Deep Learning technologies
value.excerpt: Spectrum Dynamics installs the cutting-edge methodology for attenuation correction for its D-SPECT® Series digital camera that eliminates need for CT transmission scan and multiple-positions scans. SARASOTA,

value.title: New deep learning method aids in the accurate diagnosis of parkinsonian diseases
value.excerpt: A new deep learning method has been created to aid in the diagnosis of parkinsonian diseases, according to research published ahead of print by The Journal of Nuclear Medicine.

value.title: SageMaker Serverless Inference illustrates Amazon’s philosophy for ML workloads
value.excerpt: Amazon SageMaker Serverless Inference's goal is to serve use cases with infrequent traffic patterns, lowering TCO and improving ease of use.

value.title: Design Is Merging With Machine Learning In Home Décor
value.excerpt: The blend of human and machine knowledge to address the sales challenge of home design is an interesting application of AI and other tools, a blend that can help both the businesses and the end customers.

value.title: Machine learning hiring levels in the air force industry rose in March 2022
value.excerpt: The proportion of air force equipment and technologies companies hiring for machine learning related positions rose in March 2022 compared with the equivalent month last year, with 48.5% of the companies included in our analysis recruiting for at least one such position.

value.title: AI Literacy For Finance Professionals - Three Things You Need To Know
value.excerpt: An overview of AI Literacy for Finance Professionals. Key things you need to know to apply AI effectively in finance.

value.excerpt: The human brain consists of some 86 billion neurons, nerve cells that process and convey information through electrical nerve impulses. That’s why measuring neural electrical activity is often the best way to study the brain,

value.excerpt: Using data on microtremors in Japan, a neural network model can estimate site ... Seismological Society of America introduced a novel artificial intelligence (AI)-based technique for estimating ...

value.title: Machine learning and AI is coming for corrupt officials
value.excerpt: Mark Heywood correctly asserted in the Daily Maverick that unless we introduce the certainty of punishment for corrupt public officials, we will lose the fight against corruption .  The July looting and riots taught us that these events affect our daily lives.

value.title: Deep Science: AI cuts, flows, and goes green
value.excerpt: TechCrunch's Deep Science column looks at the past week in scientific research. This edition touches on AI applied to recycling, among other topics.

value.title: DALL-E 2 shows the power of generative deep learning, but raises dispute over AI practices
value.excerpt: DALL-E 2, OpenAI's new text-to-image generator, is better than its predecessor, but comes with a debatable business model.

value.title: Comfort evaluation of ZnO coated fabrics by artificial neural network assisted with golden eagle optimizer model
value.excerpt: This paper introduces a novel technique to evaluate comfort properties of zinc oxide nanoparticles (ZnO NPs) coated woven fabrics. The proposed technique combines artificial neural network (ANN) and golden eagle optimizer (GEO) to ameliorate the training process of ANN.

value.title: 16 Tips To Help Small Businesses Start Leveraging AI/ML
value.excerpt: Even if a small business can’t make instantaneous, sweeping changes through AI/ML, it may still be the right time to take the first steps on the journey of building a strategy.
